legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Environmental Protection Expenditure

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. The UK includes England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland but excludes the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.
Exclude overseas branches, subsidiaries and agencies.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

contents.description: View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This is defined as spending incurred by businesses where the primary aim is to reduce environmental pollution caused during normal operations. For example, expenditure to:

list: reduce or prevent emissions to air or water
dispose of waste materials
protect land, soil and groundwater
prevent noise and vibration
protect the natural environment

contents.description: Include:

list: operating or running costs to external organisations and the business's own 'in-house' environment management and control activities
the purchase price of capital goods, to be recorded for the year in which they were capitalised

contents.description: Exclude:

list: depreciation or write-offs and payments of general environmental taxes
VAT
expenditure relating to health and safety
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.

This survey collects information relating to activities and spending of industries on measures to reduce various types of environmental impacts. The information you provide contributes to the UK environmental protection measures.

blocks.page_title: Reporting period section

contents.description: This is defined as spending incurred by businesses where the primary aim is to reduce environmental pollution caused during normal operations. For example, expenditure to:

list: reduce or prevent emissions to air or water
dispose of waste materials
protect land, soil and groundwater
prevent noise and vibration
protect the natural environment

contents.description: Include:

list: operating or running costs to external organisations and the business's own 'in-house' environment management and control activities
the purchase price of capital goods, to be recorded for the year in which they were capitalised

contents.description: Exclude:

list: depreciation or write-offs and payments of general environmental taxes
VAT
expenditure relating to health and safety

contents.description: Not relevant to your business?

You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. This survey collects data on environmental protection expenditure; if your business did not incur costs relating to environmental protection in the reporting period, you will be able to provide a nil return in the survey. All returns are important to us, including a nil return, as it helps produce better statistics.

title.text: Are you able to report for the period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}?

description: Select 'no' if you can only provide figures for part of this period or if you need to provide figures for a different 12 month period.

options.label: Yes, I can report for these dates
options.value: Yes, I can report for these dates

options.label: No, I need to report for a different period
options.value: No, I need to report for a different period

blocks.page_title: Calendar year reporting period

in: Yes, I can report for these dates

question.title: What dates are you reporting for?
description:
If you can report for a full 12 months, provide dates that end between 6 April 2022 and 5 April 2023.

If you traded for only part of the year, please provide the dates for the period in which you were trading.

blocks.page_title: Alternative reporting period dates
External operating expenditure section

contents.description: This section asks for information about payments to external organisations for environmental protection services.
What we mean by 'external operating expenditure'
This refers to payments made to external organisations for the treatment, disposal or investigation of solid waste, waste water, air and others. Exclude any capital expenditure.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, did {ru_name} pay an external organisation for a service that helped to protect the environment?

contents.description: Include:

list: removal of solid wastes, waste water and contaminated soil

contents.description: Exclude:

list: environmental permits, for example, sewage discharge permits

blocks.page_title: External operating costs for environmental protection services

question.title: For the reporting period, how much did your business pay to external organisations for environmental protection services?

contents.description: Include:

list: removal of solid wastes, waste water and contaminated soil

contents.description: Exclude:

list: VAT
environmental permits, for example, sewage discharge permits

answers.label: Value of external operating costs
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

blocks.page_title: Value of external operating costs for environmental protection services

title.text: Of the {value_of_external_operating_costs}, how much related to the following?

description: If you had no expenditure enter '0'. Do not leave blank.

contents.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

answers.label: Cost of other
answers.description: For example, soil or groundwater, noise or vibrations, nature protection

blocks.page_title: External operating costs breakdown

question.title: Please give more detail about the reasons for external operating expenditure, in relation to protecting the environment
description: Explain why these environmental protection activities have taken place and the environmental considerations involved in this decision.

guidance.show_guidance: Why we are asking this question
guidance.hide_guidance: Why we are asking this question

contents.description: To help us understand your figures and to tell an industry story.

blocks.page_title: More detail about external operating expenditure
In-house operating expenditure section

contents.description: This section asks for information about in-house expenditure associated with the operation of pollution control or abatement equipment.
What we mean by 'in-house'
This refers to operating costs of the business's own environment management and control activities.
What we mean by 'abatement equipment'
This refers to equipment that is used for the reduction in degree or intensity of pollution.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, did {ru_name} have any in-house operating costs for environmental protection activities?

contents.description: Exclude operating costs paid to external organisations as these should be reported in the section 'External Operating Expenditure'

definitions.title: What we mean by 'in-house operating costs'

contents.description: This refers to the operating or running costs of the business's own environmental management and control activities.
For example:

list: any labour costs for time spent carrying out work to protect the environment
leasing payment for equipment
chemicals

blocks.page_title: In-house costs for environmental protection activities

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the value of your business's in-house operating costs for all environmental protection facilities and environmental management?

contents.description: Exclude operating costs paid to external organisations as these should be reported in the section 'External Operating Expenditure'

Capital expenditure for environmental protection section

contents.description: This section asks for information about fixed assets purchased for environmental protection purposes, including end-of-pipe equipment, integrated equipment and additional costs of environmentally friendly processes.
What we mean by 'capital expenditure'
This refers to the purchase of fixed assets, which are items used repeatedly to facilitate production or provide services, for more than one year.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, did {ru_name} have any capital expenditure on end-of-pipe equipment that reduced or cleaned pollution generated by your business activity?

contents.description: This refers to equipment used to collect and remove pollutants, such as air emissions, effluents, and solid waste, after their creation.
It also refers to equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business.

blocks.page_title: Expenditure on end-of-pipe equipment

question.title: For the reporting period, what was your business's capital expenditure on end-of-pipe pollution control equipment?

contents.description: Include:

list: installation costs
equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business

contents.description: Exclude:

list: VAT

definitions.title: What we mean by 'end-of-pipe pollution control equipment'

contents.description: This refers to equipment used to collect and remove pollutants, such as air emissions, effluents, and solid waste, after their creation.
It also refers to equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business.

answers.label: Capital expenditure on end-of-pipe pollution control equipment
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

blocks.page_title: Value of expenditure on end-of-pipe pollution control equipment

title.text: Of the {_capital_expenditure_on_endofpipe_pollution_control_equipment}, how much related to the following?

description: If you had no expenditure enter '0'. Do not leave blank.

answers.label: Cost of other
answers.description: For example, soil or groundwater, noise or vibrations, nature protection

blocks.page_title: Expenditure on end-of-pipe pollution control equipment breakdown

question.title: For the reporting period, did your business have any capital expenditure on integrated equipment which made environmental protection part of the process?
description: Most new integrated processes are more efficient and contribute to reducing pollution and the use of raw materials in some way.

contents.description: This relates to new or modified production facilities, which have been designed so that environmental protection is an integral part of the process.
For example, the purchase of machinery or equipment that is built into the business’s processes and designed to minimise production waste.

blocks.page_title: Expenditure on integrated equipment

question.title: For the reporting period, what was your business's capital expenditure on integrated equipment?
description: Most new integrated processes are more efficient and contribute to reducing pollution and the use of raw materials in some way.

contents.description: This relates to new or modified production facilities, which have been designed so that environmental protection is an integral part of the process.
For example, the purchase of machinery or equipment that is built into the business’s processes and designed to minimise production waste.

answers.label: Capital expenditure on integrated equipment
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

blocks.page_title: Value of expenditure on integrated equipment

question.title: For the reporting period, did your business purchase any integrated equipment specifically for its environmental benefits, even though there may have been a cheaper, less environmentally friendly, alternative available?

contents.description: Include:

list: capital expenditure that specifically relates to the additional cost of environmentally friendly processes

contents.description: Exclude:

list: capital expenditure on integrated equipment that, while reducing environmental pollution, was not purchased for its environmental benefits
capital expenditure on standard technology and there is no cheaper less environmentally friendly alternative available

blocks.page_title: Purchase of integrated equipment specifically for its environmental benefits

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the additional cost for the environmentally friendly integrated equipment, compared with the cheaper alternative?

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

contents.description: The value of the additional cost will be the difference between what was paid for the integrated equipment, purchased specifically for its environmental benefits, and the cheaper alternative.
It can also include the adaptation of an existing installation or process. The environmental expenditure is then the total purchase cost of the adaptation.
If the selection is a standard technology and there is no cheaper, less environmentally friendly alternative available, no environmental protection expenditure should be reported.

answers.label: Additional cost of environmentally friendly integrated equipment
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

Disposals of environmental protection assets section

Climate change adaptation section

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business's adaptations to address address actual or expected changes in the climate.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, did {ru_name} adapt to address actual or expected changes in the climate?

contents.description: Exclude any actions intended to limit or prevent emissions of greenhouse gases

definitions.title: Examples of adaptations to address actual or expected changes in the climate

contents.description: Adaptations to address actual or expected changes in the climate, such as extreme weather, can include but are not limited to:

list: rethinking business strategies and finances
diversifying products, services and supply chains
installing back up power
installing heating or cooling systems
installing new flood defences
investing in resources including staffing and training

blocks.page_title: Climate change adaptations

question.title: What adaptations were made to address actual or expected changes in the climate?

contents.description: Exclude any actions intended to limit or prevent emissions of greenhouse gases

definitions.title: Examples of adaptations to address actual or expected changes in the climate

contents.description: Adaptations to address actual or expected changes in the climate, such as extreme weather, can include but are not limited to:

list: rethinking business strategies and finances
diversifying products, services and supply chains
installing back up power
installing heating or cooling systems
installing new flood defences
investing in resources including staffing and training
